Main pronunciation 主要发音: chì

Other pronunciations 其它发音: Not exists.

Original meaning 本义: Meaning (orig) naked (now) red .

English senses 英语理解: red; communist, 'red'; bare

Usage example 用法举例: 赤壁 chì bì (Chibi)

Importance by frequency 常用频率: 1373

Shuowen 说文解字: 南方色也從大從火凡赤之屬皆從赤

Character decomposition 字形分解 :
Compound 赤灻𤆍 from (rem- 土 tǔ) from person-big 大 dà and fire 火 huǒ. (name- man-fire-red 赤灻𤆍 chì)

Decomposition notes 字形分解说明 :
(- fire which heats a naked person)

灻字的基本解释

灻
chì
古同“赤”。

灻字的汉语字典释义

[①]［chì］
［《廣韻》昌石切，入昔，昌。］
亦作“灻1”。亦作“烾1”。
(1)浅朱色。亦泛指红色。
(2)古以赤为南方之色，后因以指南方。
(3)谶纬家谓汉以火德王，火色赤，后因以借指汉朝。
(4)诛灭。
(5)空尽无物。
(6)外表无所遮饰；裸露。
(7)纯真；忠诚。
(8)指真诚之心。
(9)“赤子”的简称。本指婴儿，后亦比喻百姓。
(10)指鲜血。
(11)用以象征革命或革命胜利。
(12)旧时亦以指共产党。
(13)蒙古语中表示“人”的后缀，犹汉语的“者”。
(14)象声词。
(15)“赤縣”的简称。
(16)通“尺”。
(17)通“斥”。指斥候，古代军中侦察敌情的人。
[②]［chì］
［《集韻》七迹切，入昔，清。］
亦作“烾2”。
除掉；扫除。参见“赤2犮”。

灻字的康熙字典解释

【巳集中】【火字部】　灻； 康熙笔画：7； 页码：页666第16
【海篇】與赤同。

灻字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体韩国明朝体
灻字的起名意思

暂无。

灻
Basic explanation of words
灻
chì
Ancient with "red".
灻
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［chì］
["Guangyun" Changshi cuts into the past, Chang. ]
Also known as "灻1". Also known as "烾1".
(1) Light vermilion. Also refers to red in general.
(2) In ancient times, red was the color of the south, and later it was used as a guide.
(3) Zhenwei's family said that the Han Dynasty was the king of fire and morality, and the color of fire was red, and later because of borrowing to refer to the Han Dynasty.
(4) Exterminate.
(5) Empty and empty.
(6) Nothing to hide on the outside; bare.
(7) Innocence; loyalty.
(8) Refers to sincere heart.
(9) The abbreviation of "Chizi". Originally refers to babies, but later is also a metaphor for the common people.
(10) Refers to blood.
(11) It is used to symbolize the revolution or the victory of the revolution.
(12) In the old days, it was also used to refer to the Communist Party.
(13) The suffix for "person" in Mongolian is just like "zhe" in Chinese.
(14) Onomatopoeia.
(15) The abbreviation of "Chixian".
(16) Through "ruler".
(17) Through "reject". Refers to a scout, a person in the ancient army who scouts the enemy.
[②]［chì］
["Jiyun" seven traces cut, into the past, Qing. ]
Also known as "烾2".
Get rid of; See "Red 2 Ya".
灻
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Si Collection] [Fire Word Department] 　灻; Kangxi strokes: 7; Page number: page 666 to 16
[Sea] Same as Chi.
